newsitem.title: USA: ComEd shuts LaSalle 2 Ill. power plant.
newsitem.headline: ComEd shuts LaSalle 2 Ill. power plant.

text.p: Commonwealth Edison Co (ComEd), confirming a report from the Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC), said Friday it shut its 1,078 megawatt (MW) LaSalle 2 nuclear power plant for refueling.
A company spokesman for the Chicago-based utility said the outage, which began early Friday, would last about 65 days.
The NRC reported the adjacent LaSalle 1 reactor was continuing to produce electricity at 100 percent of its rated 1,078 MW capacity.
The LaSalle facility is located at Seneca, Ill.
ComEd, a unit of Unicom Corp, operates 12 nuclear power plants in Illinois, with a total capacity of 11,487 MW, or about 51 percent of the company's overall generating capacity.
